page.title: 16Types of Housing in Creeting
page.content: We took an area in the centre of Creeting St. Mary to compare the types of housing. Altogether we surveyed 65 houses. Much the largest group were recently built detached houses. There were 27 in all. Next came modern chalet bungalows. There were 12 of these. Closely follow- ing this were 10 semi-detached houses{8 of these were post-war council houses}. After this came 6 semi-detached cottages and 5 detached cottages. Many of these had been built in the 16th and 17th centuries and all were over 100 years old. Finally there were three old terraced cottages and two modern bungalows. This survey showed and was fairly typical of the whole village, that there were very few really old houses and that by far the majority had been built in the last 30 years.
